properties.title: left home
properties.description: Noé - my roommate - and I left the house at the same time - he for the train to Ottawa, me for Chicago. He gallantly took a photo of me next to our week's trash and I got on the road.

properties.title: meet french dude on gt
properties.description: Right as I pulled onto des Érables, I noticed a person on an old GT bike riding alongside. I complimented him on the bike, and we got to talking. Turns out he was commuting to his job in Longueuil so we took the Jacques-Cartier together as he asked me about my trip. I peeled off at Île Ste-Hélène and we made our goodbyes.

properties.title: blocked by tandem bike race
properties.description: As I made it to the Circuit Gilles-Villeneuve my path was blocked, and on the track I noticed that tandem cyclists were racing. I did not know this existed. I watched for a bit before the security guard gruffly gave me detour instructions.

properties.title: make horrible decision to get on snowmobile path
properties.description: I compounded my unease with the headwinds by trusting the gravel of a snowmobile path, which was far too coarse, leaving me fearing an imminent flat that luckily did not materialize.

properties.title: wrong turn costs me 10 km
properties.description: I took a wrong turn off of the awful snowmobile path to drain a further ten kilometres into the void.

properties.title: stop at cute gas station in howick
bike path turns to garbage, another detour
properties.description: Once I'd arrived at Sainte-Martine, a real bike path became available to me - that is, until it dead-ended in a random farm with no warning, happily incurring yet another detour, this time into the most brutal wind I would meet all day.

properties.title: go to casse-croûte forgetting i have no cash
properties.description: The detour eventually landed me in Huntingdon, where I planned on eating some poutine, only to realize that the casse-croûte was cash-only. Amateur mistake.

properties.title: gatorade restock at pharmacy in lieu of actual food
properties.description: I substituted these much-needed poutine calories, rather ill-advisedly, with a pharmacy Gatorade. The woman at the register was very kind - and greeted me in English! - reminding me that, for all of my missteps, I was at least making southwestern progress.

properties.title: take deep breath, stop pushing too hard
properties.description: Then followed the longest stretch of road for the day, where halfway through I finally found common sense, stopped, stretched, drank some water, and pledged to myself to take it easy. Why rush when I had left early enough for a comfortable arrival time, even at snail’s pace?

properties.title: us customs people just wave me thru thank u
onion rings yum yum
properties.description: I made it to Frankie’s Hot Dog Stand in Fort Covington just twenty minutes prior to their peculiar closing time of 3pm and had a “Glazier” hot dog and some stellar onion rings. The restaurant was adjacent to the town park, which featured tidbits of its history in the War of 1812. I stretched, laid in the grass, and shut my eyes. The detours had added twelve kilometres onto an already long day, so some respite before the last stretch was much welcome.

properties.title: buy sub and water at twinleaf for night
catch draft behind amish horsecart
properties.description: The last hour and a half or so of my journey largely involved traversing Amish homesteads. I even drafted a horse cart on the country highway for a kilometre or so. They seemed to have vehicles much more optimized for their use than the ostentatiously oversized pickups dangerously passing them.

properties.title: lovely forest gravel road
properties.description: My left turn onto Keenan Road marked the very last stretch of the day - more than ten kilometres of roads where I was passed by no more than one or two cars. The last eight kilometres brought me into Brasher Falls State Forest, my campsite for the day.

properties.title: pitch tent megaquick because mosquitoes eating me alive
properties.description: I arrived at 5:40pm or so, quickly set up camp given the concentration of mosquitoes (and my avaricious lack of bug juice!), and devoured the gas station sub that I had provisioned as dinner at the Fort Covington Twinleaf gas station.
